fields.physical_description:
This is a rather crude toy; hand turned and painted but not smoothed down. It is the stylized form of a male figure painted in red; yellow; purple; turquoise; black; green and pink to show the head; body and hands of
a man holding a bowl and large spoon. The figure wears a cap; has curly blond hair and is turning its head to the left. The shirt is decorated with dots and flowers. The legs and feet are represented by plain areas of purple and red. 
*Underneath is a fragment of printed paper; this is the original label applied when the toy was given to the co-operative. It has been partly destroyed and parts (including the date) are missing. This toy was made to traditional designs and it would have been sold to the Co-operative group for sale. Although the area co-operatives have been replaced there is still no credit given to an actual maker.
Vanka is a figure which can be seen in many different materials. It is a toy representing a traditional folk character called IVAN; a centuries old figure who always wins but is regarded as simple but resourceful. Vanka is a corruption of the name IVAN; similar to Bobbie and Robert.
fields.title: VANKA
fields.marks: original co-operative label; partly torn away
fields.history_note:
References: RUSSIAN FOLK TOYS booklet published by the Museum of Toys; USSR Academy of Pedagogical Sciences. see registered packet

Collection was presented to BGM by the Traditional Sergiev Cultures Centre; following an exhibition at the Cambridge Folk Museum; September 1994. The items are modern; made to the traditional designs and methods by craftsmen whose families had produced the toys before 1900.

Price: £10.00
fields.production_note:
Made by: made in the village of Polkhov-Maidan; in the region of Nizhni
Novgorod; no known maker
Russia
